summary: "The Marriage of Figaro" is an opera by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, first performed in 1786. Based on a play by Pierre Beaumarchais, it tells the story of servants Figaro and Susanna, who outsmart their boss, Count Almaviva, when he tries to break up their wedding. They teach him a lesson about being faithful. It's one of the most popular and greatest operas ever written, known for its funny and heartwarming story, and Mozart's amazing music.
title: The Marriage of Figaro
